question.title: Is there a way to turn off breaking long words in OpenPDF?
question.body:
I am currently working with OpenPDF (V. 2.0.3) in Java and implementing some text features. Both ColumnText and PdfPCell are used in that context - and both show the same "issue", as I will call it in my case. If I add a very long word that would not fit the given (or calculated) width of said elements, that word will be cut arbitrarily so that part of it will fit the line. I have not yet found a way to turn that off. What I would like to do is throw an error, if the width of the element would be exceeded (I would actually try to decrease font size and try again until a set limit is reached).

I did try to implement my own SplitCharacter, but to no avail.

So my question is: Is there any way to change that behavior?

EDIT: For clarification, I need this to work with not only one long string but a multi-line text, too. So if only one word in that text would not fit the line but the entire text (with the long word split into smaller, fitting pieces) would fit the column I would like to know this.

answers.body:
ColumnText.go() will return NO_MORE_TEXT if the text fit inside the shape NO_MORE_COLUMN if the text is overflowing.

You could throw exception or add another shape for the overflow when NO_MORE_COLUMN is returned.

See example from https://stackoverflow.com/a/68419550/1089967

Document document = new Document(PageSize.A4);
PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream("overflow.pdf"));
document.open();

// define text
PdfContentByte canvas = writer.getDirectContent();
ColumnText ct = new ColumnText(canvas);
ct.addElement(new Paragraph(LOREM_IPSUM)); // <- some filler text from constant

// fill first box
ct.setSimpleColumn(50, 735, 400, 800);
int result = ct.go();

// fill second box (if necessary)
if (result == ColumnText.NO_MORE_COLUMN) {
    ct.setSimpleColumn(75, 635, 425, 700);
    result = ct.go();
}

// fill third box (if necessary)
if (result == ColumnText.NO_MORE_COLUMN) {
    ct.setSimpleColumn(100, 535, 450, 600);
    result = ct.go();
}

document.close();

question_comments.body: Thanks for the input! I was afraid it would be something like that. I don't quite know where I would start with patching the existing code, so I guess I'll have to resort to pre-processing the string.

If I see this correctly, this behavior is hard coded into BidiLine.processLine(). Thus, you either have to pre-process your string by looking for long words in it, or you have to patch or duplicate the code to match your requirements.

79592520.body: I actually found out about that and it does generally help - but not when there is more text which overall fits. I'll update my question for clarification.
